item.title: Backpacks: Products of Crowd Sourcing
item.description:
Why start my first post on backpacks?

I think there are a few items that make life better everyday. Having a great pack comes first because we need something to hold everything. I love having a pack that I can just grab and go and know I can handle anything throught my day.

In general, I am very careful with my money, but I rationalize spending more for things that really matter and would rather have less things but my thngs be better quality. The things I will be using everyday are worth higher quality beause spreading out the cost/usage, spending more just makes sense.

Factors

Criteria:

  1. Style
  2. Easily handle water bottles
  3. Lots of pockets and organization
  4. Minimal effort to access what you need
  5. Unique
  6. High quality materials

Different Uses:

  • Everyday bag, more general
  • Photography
  • Travel

Past Bags

I started out with finding Timbuk2 in high school. I first tried the basic messenger and then another random bag from them that was on sale.

Then I tried the Osprey Pixel. This bag met a lot of my expectations, such as pockets and organization, but contained the following flaws:

  • No outside water bottle pocket, this is a huge red flag because carrying around a water bottle on the inside of a bag takes up a lot of space and can spill, not to mention it is hard to access.
  • Side access laptop access, if you forget to close this, the laptop falls right out. I dented my MacBook air because of this

I now have ordered the Everyday BackPack from Indiegogo 30L because I wasnâ€™t satisfied with the Pixel.

The Options

I want to just jot down a bunch of the bags I have considered and thought cool. From there I will identify more prominent bags that stick out among bags that are already good.

I think it is best to get volume so that if nothing I pick is quite the best, you still have many more options to explore
